contextId.information: This is a polite way of saying "I am going to die." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: I am going the way of all the earth

contextId.information: In this euphemism, sleeping represents dying. AT: "Abijah died as his ancestors had" or "Like his ancestors, Abaijah died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This is a polite way of saying the boy died. AT: "he stopped breathing" or "he died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: there was no more breath left in him

contextId.information: This euphemism is a more pleasant way to express a harsh statement. Elijah uses understatement to insult Baal with sarcasm. AT: "in the bathroom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
